intro: Calatola pastazana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Calatola pastazana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
